title: BPMN 2.0
description: This is the BPMN 2.0 stencil set specification.

properties.title: Id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the element.

properties.title: Name
properties.description: The descriptive name of the BPMN element.

properties.title: Documentation
properties.description: The descriptive name of the BPMN element.

properties.title: Process identifier
properties.description: Unique identifier of the process definition.

properties.title: Process author
properties.description: Author of the process definition.

properties.title: Executable
properties.description: Define if the process is executable.

properties.title: Process version string (documentation only)
properties.description: Version identifier for documentation purpose.

properties.title: Target namespace
properties.description: Target namespace for the process definition.

properties.title: Form key
properties.description: Form key of the user task.

properties.title: Due date
properties.description: Due date of the user task.

properties.title: Priority
properties.description: Priority of the user task.

properties.title: Assignments
properties.description: Assignment definition for the user task

complexItems.name: Resource assignment expression
complexItems.description: This defines the expression used for the resource assignment.
complexItems.description_de: Definiert den Ausdruck, der fr die Zordung von Ressourcen genutzt wird.

properties.title: Form properties
properties.description: Definition of the form with a list of form properties

complexItems.name: Id
complexItems.description: This defines the expression used for the resource assignment.
complexItems.description_de: Definiert den Ausdruck, der fr die Zordung von Ressourcen genutzt wird.

complexItems.name: Name
complexItems.description: This defines the expression used for the resource assignment.
complexItems.description_de: Definiert den Ausdruck, der fr die Zordung von Ressourcen genutzt wird.

complexItems.name: Expression
complexItems.description: This defines the expression used for the resource assignment.
complexItems.description_de: Definiert den Ausdruck, der fr die Zordung von Ressourcen genutzt wird.

complexItems.name: Variable
complexItems.description: This defines the expression used for the resource assignment.
complexItems.description_de: Definiert den Ausdruck, der fr die Zordung von Ressourcen genutzt wird.

properties.title: Task listeners
properties.description: Listeners for a user task

properties.title: Class
properties.description: Class that implements the service task logic.

properties.title: Expression
properties.description: Service task logic defined with an expression.

properties.title: Delegate expression
properties.description: Service task logic defined with a delegate expression.

properties.title: Result variable name
properties.description: Process variable name to store the service task result.

properties.title: Class fields
properties.description: Field extensions

properties.title: Script format
properties.description: Script format of the script task.

properties.title: Script
properties.description: Script text of the script task.

properties.title: Class
properties.description: Class of the rule task.

properties.title: Input variables
properties.description: Input variables of the rule task.

properties.title: Result variable
properties.description: Result variable of the rule task.

properties.title: Rules
properties.description: Rules of the rule task.

properties.title: Exclude
properties.description: Use the rules property as exclusion.

properties.title: To
properties.description: The recipients if the e-mail. Multiple recipients are defined in a comma-separated list.

properties.title: From
properties.description: The sender e-mail address. If not provided, the default configured from address is used.

properties.title: Subject
properties.description: The subject of the e-mail.

properties.title: Cc
properties.description: The cc's of the e-mail. Multiple recipients are defined in a comma-separated list

properties.title: Bcc
properties.description: The bcc's of the e-mail. Multiple recipients are defined in a comma-separated list

properties.title: Text
properties.description: The content of the e-mail, in case one needs to send plain none-rich e-mails. Can be used in combination with html, for e-mail clients that don't support rich content. The client will then fall back to this text-only alternative.

properties.title: Html
properties.description: A piece of HTML that is the content of the e-mail.

properties.title: Charset
properties.description: Allows to change the charset of the email, which is necessary for many non-English languages.

properties.title: Called element
properties.description: Process reference.

properties.title: In parameters
properties.description: Definition of the input parameters

properties.title: Out parameters
properties.description: Definition of the output parameters

properties.title: Flow condition
properties.description: The condition of the sequence flow

properties.title: Default flow
properties.description: Define the sequence flow as default

properties.title: Conditional flow
properties.description: Define the sequence flow with a condition

properties.title: Time duration (e.g. PT5M)
properties.description: Define the timer with a ISO-8601 duration.

properties.title: Time date in ISO-8601
properties.description: Define the timer with a ISO-8601 date definition.

properties.title: Time cycle (e.g. R3/PT10H)
properties.description: Define the timer with a ISO-8601 cycle.

properties.title: Message reference
properties.description: Define the message name.

properties.title: Signal reference
properties.description: Define the signal name.

properties.title: Error reference
properties.description: Define the error name.

properties.title: Initiator
properties.description: Initiator of the process.

properties.title: Form key
properties.description: Form key of the start event.

properties.title: Text
properties.description: The text of the text annotation.

properties.title: Asynchronous
properties.description: Define the activity as asynchronous.

properties.title: Exclusive
properties.description: Define the activity as exclusive.

properties.title: Execution listeners
properties.description: Listeners for an activity, process, sequence flow, start and end event.

properties.title: Custom form
properties.description: Des A

properties.title: Loop type
properties.description: Repeated activity execution (parallel or sequential) can be displayed through different loop types

properties.title: Sequential (Multi-instance)
properties.description: Define the multi instance as sequential.

properties.title: Cardinality (Multi-instance)
properties.description: Define the cardinality of multi instance.

properties.title: Collection (Multi-instance)
properties.description: Define the collection for the multi instance.

properties.title: Element variable (Multi-instance)
properties.description: Define the element variable for the multi instance.

properties.title: Completion condition (Multi-instance)
properties.description: Define the completion condition for the multi instance.

properties.title: Is for compensation
properties.description: A flag that identifies whether this activity is intended for the purposes of compensation.

properties.title: ProcessID
properties.description: Defines the ID of the container process used in the exported BPMN 2.0 XML. The ID has to be a valid XSD:id string and identifies a process unambiguous.

properties.title: BackgroundColor
properties.description: Change the background color for a visual differentiation.

properties.title: Border color
properties.description: Change the border color for a visual differentiation.

properties.title: Processtype
properties.description: The process type attribute provides additional information about the level of abstraction modeled by this process.

properties.title: Is closed
properties.description: A boolean value specifying whether interactions, such as sending and receiving messages and events, not modeled in the process can occur when the process is executed or performed. If the value is true, they may not occur. If the value is false, they may occur.

properties.title: Is executable
properties.description: An optional boolean value specifying whether the process is executable.

properties.title: Is multi instance participant
properties.description: Is used to define the multiplicity of a participant (multi instance).

properties.title: Minimum
properties.description: The minimum attribute defines minimum number of participants that must be involved in the collaboration.

properties.title: Maximum
properties.description: The maximum attribute defines the maximum number of participants that may be involved in the collaboration.

properties.title: Boundary visible
properties.description: Defines if the rectangular boundary for the pool is visible.

properties.title: Processname
properties.description: The name of the participants process.

properties.title: State
properties.description: The current state of the participants process execution.

properties.title: Ad hoc
properties.description: Defines whether the Pool acts like an ad-hoc subprocess.

properties.title: Ad hoc ordering
properties.description: This attribute defines if the activities within the subprocess can be performed in parallel or must be performed sequentially. The default is parallel.

properties.title: Ad hoc completion condition
properties.description: This attribute defines a Boolean Expression that, when evaluated to true, cancels the remaining Activity instances and produces a token.

stencils.title: BPMN-Diagram
stencils.description: A BPMN 2.0 diagram.

stencils.title: Pool
stencils.description: Pools and Lanes represent responsibilities for activities in a process. A pool or a lane can be an organization, a role or a system.

properties.title: Border color
properties.description: Change the border color for a visual differentiation.

stencils.title: Collapsed Pool
stencils.description: Collapsed pools hide all internals of the contained processes ('black box').

properties.title: Background color
properties.description: Change the background color for a visual differentiation.

properties.title: Border color
properties.description: Change the border color for a visual differentiation.

stencils.title: Lane
stencils.description: Pools and lanes represent responsibilities for activities in a process. A pool or a lane can be an organization, a role or a system. Lanes subdivide pools or other lanes hierarchically.

properties.title: Parent pool
properties.description: The specified pool the lane belongs to.

properties.title: Parent lane
properties.description: The specified lane the lane belongs to.

properties.title: Background color
properties.description: Change the background color for a visual differentiation.

properties.title: Border color
properties.description: Change the border color for a visual differentiation.

stencils.title: Additional Participant
stencils.description: An additional participant can be connected to a task or sub process. It is used to visualize additional associations of roles or individuals to the respective activity (e.g. responsibility, informed persons, etc.).

properties.title: Border color
properties.description: Change the border color for a visual differentiation.

stencils.title: Start event
stencils.description: A start event without a specific trigger

stencils.title: Start timer event
stencils.description: A start event with a timer trigger

stencils.title: Start message event
stencils.description: A start event with a message trigger

stencils.title: Start error event
stencils.description: A start event that catches a thrown BPMN error

stencils.title: User task
stencils.description: A manual task assigned to a specific person

stencils.title: Service task
stencils.description: An automatic task with service logic

stencils.title: Script task
stencils.description: An automatic task with script logic

stencils.title: Business rule task
stencils.description: An automatic task with rule logic

stencils.title: Receive task
stencils.description: An task that waits for a signal

stencils.title: Manual task
stencils.description: An automatic task with no logic

stencils.title: Mail task
stencils.description: An mail task

stencils.title: Send task
stencils.description: A send task

stencils.title: Sub process
stencils.description: A sub process scope

stencils.title: Event sub process
stencils.description: A event sub process scope

stencils.title: Call activity
stencils.description: A call activity

stencils.title: Exclusive gateway
stencils.description: A choice gateway

stencils.title: Parallel gateway
stencils.description: A parallel gateway

stencils.title: Inclusive gateway
stencils.description: An inclusive gateway

stencils.title: Event gateway
stencils.description: An event gateway

stencils.title: Boundary error event
stencils.description: A boundary event that catches a BPMN error

stencils.title: Boundary timer event
stencils.description: A boundary event with a timer trigger

stencils.title: Boundary signal event
stencils.description: A boundary event with a signal trigger

stencils.title: Intermediate timer catching event
stencils.description: An intermediate catching event with a timer trigger

stencils.title: Intermediate signal catching event
stencils.description: An intermediate catching event with a signal trigger

stencils.title: Intermediate message catching event
stencils.description: An intermediate catching event with a message trigger

stencils.title: Intermediate none throwing event
stencils.description: An intermediate event without a specific trigger

stencils.title: Intermediate signal throwing event
stencils.description: An intermediate event with a signal trigger

stencils.title: End event
stencils.description: An end event without a specific trigger

stencils.title: End error event
stencils.description: An end event that throws an error event

stencils.title: Sequence flow
stencils.description: Sequence flow defines the execution order of activities.

stencils.title: Association
stencils.description: Associates a text annotation with an element.

stencils.title: Message Flow
stencils.description: Message flow symbolizes information flow across organizational boundaries. Message flow can be attached to pools, activities or message events. The order of message exchanges can be specified by combining message flow and sequence flow.

properties.title: Border color
properties.description: Change the border color for a visual differentiation.

stencils.title: Text annotation
stencils.description: Annotates elements with description text.
